title: Localisation QA Test Lead
description:
**Why PlayStation?**

PlayStation isn‚Äôt just the Best Place to Play ‚Äî it‚Äôs also the Best Place to Work. Today, we‚Äôre recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation¬Æ5, PlayStation¬Æ4, PlayStation¬ÆVR, PlayStation¬ÆPlus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Group Corporation.

**Role overview:**

The Localisation Test Lead is responsible for managing the Localisation Testing of products within PlayStation Studios.

You‚Äôll bring your experience and skills in the Localisation QA space to our team and in return you‚Äôll have the opportunity to work on the biggest and best games. You will work on ground-breaking hardware and video games within a large multicultural, global team; helping us drive and build the future of games & games testing.

**What you‚Äôll be doing:**

* Own the creation and communication of test plans for assigned products to Test teams, production, and global stakeholders
* Communicate with producers and global stakeholders, ensuring they are kept up to date with testing progress and title status
* Create and implement appropriate resource plans, including vendors, and supporting Test Managers in generating title budgets
* Manage global Test teams, including onsite testing staff and vendors, for assigned products
* Provide day to day direction, support, and guidance to Test teams
* Maintain excellent knowledge of QA services both current and emerging
* Collaborate with peer group and global teams to promote knowledge sharing and the cultivation of innovation within PlayStation Studios QA
* Gather feedback and data to build and facilitate global facing retrospectives, new services, strategies, and tools
* Maintaining, developing, and promoting knowledge in the field of quality assurance through attendance at training courses and self-directed learning

**What we are looking for:**

* Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects at once
* Extensive knowledge and practical expertise in quality assurance/software testing
* Quality assurance and quality control techniques, methodologies, and practices
* Understanding Test Strategy and Resource Management
* Lead and manage remote teams through global communication
* Communicate clearly with internal and external customers globally
* Expertise in cross-cultural business and remote team interaction
* Demonstrated knowledge of defect tracking systems and web-based database utilisation
* Demonstrated experience with building and managing effective teams

**Nice to have:**

* Knowledge of the localisation industry
* Previous experience within a QA Operations environment
* Successfully shipped global titles on current generation platforms
* ISTQB Foundation level qualification or higher
* ITIL certification
* Project Management accreditation
* Experience in organisational change and conflict resolution
* Proficiency in another language

**Benefits:**

* 25 days holiday per year
* Flexitime working (where approved)
* Free car parking facilities
* On Site Gym
* Subsidised Caf√©
* On site bar
* Access to cycle garage and showers

Please note, Sony Interactive Entertainment conducts background checks at the offer stage for all new employees (which may include criminal background checks for some roles) and will need to process personal information to support these checks.

**Equal Opportunity Statement:**

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy, maternity or parental status, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

title: Junior QA Engineer
description:
Veeam, the #1 global market leader in data resilience, believes businesses should control all their data whenever and wherever they need it. Veeam provides data resilience through data backup, data recovery, data portability, data security, and data intelligence. Based in Seattle, Veeam protects over 550,000 customers worldwide who trust Veeam to keep their businesses running. Join us as we move forward together, growing, learning, and making a real impact for some of the world‚Äôs biggest brands. The future of data resilience is here - go fearlessly forward with us.

##### About the Role

The Veeam Quality Assurance team invites you to work on Veeam products with Veeam QA professionals in the Warsaw R&D office.¬†QA has the power to breathe life into our products. Testers are always at the center of the action: developing an idea, thinking through the functionality, and conducting a thousand complex experiments is all easy, and this is not the limit. The goal of QA is a quality product and millions of happy users confident that ‚ÄúVeeam just works.‚Äù

##### What You‚Äôll Do

* ‚ÄúDeep diving‚Äù into our products, technology and profession
* Analysing software requirements
* Testing one or several Veeam products
* Communicating with other participants of the product development process
* Evaluating test results, maintaining defects database

##### What You‚Äôll Bring

* Technical education or passion for technology
* 1 year of experience in system administration, software testing, or networking
* Looking for your first job in IT or already working as a test engineer, software developer or system administrator
* Willing to grow professionally in the software testing field
* Advanced knowledge of Windows or Linux operating systems
* Understanding of network technologies and systems (DNS, DHCP, basic network settings, etc.)
* Curious, attentive and tend to note flaws in everything around you
* An open-minded person with common sense and clear logic
* A fast learner (passionate eyes outweigh knowledge gaps) and you love interesting and challenging tasks
* English proficiency for daily communication within international teams

##### What You‚Äôll Get

* 26 paid days off annually, plus 3 global VeeaMe Days for self-care and paid volunteer time
* Paid parental, maternity, andpaternity leave
* Fully covered family medical plan, dental, rehab, and vaccinations
* Life, critical illness, and disability insurance
* Employer pension contribution via PPK
* Monthly Edenred allowance of 450 PLN for meals
* MultiSport card fully covered by Veeam, giving access to sports facilities nationwide
* Six free therapy sessions, plus legal and financial advice
* Professional training and education, including courses and workshops, internal meetups, and unlimited access to our online learning platforms (LinkedIn Learning, Athena, O‚ÄôReilly) and mentoring through our MentorLab program

**Please note:**

Please note that any personal data collected from you during the recruitment process will be processed in accordance with ourRecruiting Privacy Notice.

The Privacy Notice sets out the basis on which the personal data collected from you, or that you provide to us, will be processed by us in connection with our recruitment processes.

By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal data in accordance with ourRecruiting Privacy Notice.

title: QA Analyst
description:
* Review and evaluate customer interactions across chat, email, video, and social media channels to ensure adherence to Holafly‚Äôs quality standards and protocols.
* Monitor agent performance using key metrics established in the operation.
* Monitor AI performance using key metrics established in the operation.
* Identify coaching opportunities and provide detailed feedback to agents and team leaders to improve performance and consistency.
* Calibrate quality evaluations with other QA analysts and leaders to ensure fairness and alignment across the team.
* Create and escalate action plans with managers to improve the performance of team members.

Why Join Us?

What You'll Be DoingWe‚Äôre looking for a QA Engineer to join our team! You'd be responsible for both manual and automated testing as well as contributing to best practices throughout the SDLC working closely with our Software Engineers and Product Managers to provide governance and oversight of the quality of the products we develop. We're also big on running POCs to help improve various aspects of QA so there's plenty of interesting work to get stuck into!

* Proven software quality assurance experience with a focus on both web and mobile applications
* Experience developing tests for functional and regression testing that include manual, automated, performance and ad-hoc testing
* Pragmatic when raising bugs and have a good understanding of risk, impact, dependencies and how to balance these
* Understand the full E2E impact of changes, considering these in the QA strategy and approach
* Experience with C# is preferable (or similar OOPs languages)

* Experience working with and testing REST APIs
* Experience working across multiple teams.
* Understands CI/CD concepts and implement continuous testing practices
* Excellent attention to detail and a methodical approach to testing
* Understand the concept of checking against testing, strong knowledge of exploratory testing.
* Bias for action and problem solving - eagerness to take initiative and make things happen
* Proficient in SQL Server queries and scripting experience.

Nice to have skills:

* Previous exposure to Microsoft Azure DevOps
* Experience with usability best practices; able to influence and improve user experience
* ISTQB certification desirable
* Experience of working in a fintech company.

These values drive us to build strong connections within our community and with our partners, ensuring trust, integrity, and transparency in all our business practices. Our approach is rooted in efficient collaboration among passionate professionals working in agile teams. Guided by curiosity and ambition, we strive to create products that are meaningful and impactful, while remaining true to our authentic selves.

title: Principal PLC/Automation Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Principal PLC/Automation Engineer who will lead the launch of a new project from the ground up. In this role, you will design and implement the automation architecture, develop PLC-based control systems, and integrate energy-efficient solutions.

You will collaborate closely with cross-functional specialists, define technical requirements, select appropriate hardware and control strategies, and ensure reliable, sustainable system performance.

**PROJECT**

This is a new greenfield project, aimed at developing advanced water treatment technologies with optimized energy consumption. The solution will integrate solar and alternative energy sources to ensure sustainable and stable operation.

### Job Description

* Design and program PLC-based automation systems
* Develop HMI/SCADA interfaces and monitoring tools
* Integrate sensors, pumps, VFDs, and instrumentation for water-cleaning processes
* Implement energy-optimized control strategies adapted to renewable power sources
* Create system documentation (FDS, control narratives, test plans, electrical diagrams)
* Lead FAT, on-site commissioning, troubleshooting, and optimization
* Ensure compliance with safety, quality, and electrical standards
* Coordinate with process, mechanical, and electrical teams throughout the project

### Qualifications

* 10+ years in industrial automation/PLC engineering
* Proven background in process automation (preferably water/wastewater)
* Hands-on experience with VFDs, industrial networks (Profinet, Modbus), and instrumentation
* Ability to design control architecture and lead full lifecycle from concept to commissioning
* Strong understanding of electrical principles, panel design, and safety standards
* Excellent problem-solving and documentation skills
* English level: Upper-Intermediate or higher

title: Software Quality Assurance Specialist III
description:
Software Quality Assurance Specialist III is responsible for ensuring that all computerized systems used in healthcare operations comply with regulatory requirements such as FDA 21 CFR Part 11 and EU Annex 11. This role is critical in maintaining data integrity, patient safety, and product quality through rigorous validation of software and systems.

Key Responsibilities

* Project Leader¬†for Computer System Validation (CSV) programs across Jabil Healthcare, ensuring alignment with global and site-specific objectives.
* Subject Matter Expert (SME)¬†in the validation of computerized quality systems and applications, providing strategic guidance and technical oversight.
* Lead compliance initiatives related to¬†FDA 21 CFR Part 11¬†and¬†EU Annex 11, ensuring systems meet regulatory expectations.
* Coach and mentor CSV leads/supervisors on procedures, forms, templates, and regulatory requirements, fostering a culture of compliance and continuous improvement.
* Drivethe¬†standardizationof CSVprocesses¬†acrossthe site in accordance with global, regional, and site-level directives.
* Champion adherence to¬†global regulations and standards, including ISO 13485, FDA 21 CFR Part 11, and EU Annex 11.
* Provide supportduring¬†regulatoryaudits and inspections, ensuring readiness and robust documentation.
* Accountable for CSV metrics to the¬†global metrics team, contributing to enterprise-wide performance tracking.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (QA, IT, Manufacturing, R&D) to define system requirements and validation strategies.
* Ensure all validation activities are conducted in accordance with¬†Jabil CSV procedures¬†and associated work instructions.
* Review and¬†approve validation deliverables, ensuring completeness, accuracy, and compliance.
* Monitor the¬†Master System Inventory, ensuring accurate tracking of all GxP systems.
* Monitor system performance and revalidate as necessary after upgrades or changes.
* Lead¬†periodic reviews¬†of GxP systems and conduct¬†risk assessments and impact analyses¬†for both new and existing systems.
* Ensure compliance with thecompany‚Äôs¬†securitypolicies and procedures.
* Perform additional duties and responsibilities as assigned, contributing to the overall success of the CSV program.

title: Quality Assurance Engineer ‚Äì EU/India
description:
**About the Role**

We are looking for a motivated Quality Assurance Engineer (QAE) to join our distributed team across Europe or India. You will play a key role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our existing product, working directly with product lead and clients to understand issues, provide release confidence, and maintain high standards for product delivery. This role requires someone who is a quick learner, independent, and comfortable in a fully remote, client-facing environment.

* Provide release confidence and validation reports directly to      clients

* Located in Europe or India

**Nice to Have**

* Experience with ERP systems or enterprise software
* Experience working in SaaS, B2B, or customer-facing products
* Familiarity with automated testing frameworks or scripting

* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information      Technology, or a related field or      equivalent practical experience

description:
##### Who we are

We simplify wealth creation. Founded in 2014 in Vienna, Austria by Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek and Christian Trummer, we‚Äôre here to help people trust themselves enough to build their financial freedom ‚Äî for now and the future. Our user-friendly, trade-everything platform empowers both first-time investors and seasoned experts to invest in the cryptocurrencies, crypto indices, stocks*, precious metals and commodities* they want ‚Äî with any sized budget, 24/7. Our global team works across different cultures and time zones, bringing our products to more than 6 million customers, making us one of Europe‚Äôs safest and most secure platforms that powers modern investing.

Headquartered in Austria but operating across Europe, our products are built by fast-moving, talented, ‚Äúroll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen‚Äù kind of people. It‚Äôs these diverse perspectives and innovative minds operating as ONE TEAM that keep Bitpanda at the cutting edge of our industry. So if you‚Äôre someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry-changing team. Let‚Äôs go!

##### 

**What you‚Äôll do**

##### 

* Assess quality on BP DeFi Wallet, creating and executing test plans performing manual and automated testing
* Actively participate throughout the whole development cycle and co-shape the scrum practices and ceremonies, and mentor a QA intern and dev colleagues on QA topics.
* Refine QA processes (drive left shift, advocate for higher usability, testability and security)
* Participate in developing, extending and maintaining automation frameworks (playwright E2E and integration as well as API and load tests), co-shaping our CI/CD pipelines to increase product quality and confidence, and feedback speed
* Own, shape and refine the release testing strategy (cadence, devices, scope of testing, automation)

##### 

**Who you are**

* Possess well-rounded QA experience with a strong focus onmobile testing, complemented by solid experience in bothFront-EndandBack-Endquality assurance.
* Payments experience and an active interest in and enthusiasm for theWeb3space.
* Havestrong analytical skillsto identify problems that matter and investigate bugs and patterns
* Demonstrate a strongunderstanding of Scrum and Kanbanmethodologies, coupled with a solid grasp ofgood coding practicesessential for maintainable automation and collaboration.
* Provenexperience developing and extending automation frameworks(ideally Front End facing and/or using TypeScript), and successfully integrating them into CI/CD pipelines (e.g., GitLab).

##### What‚Äôs in it for you

* Flexibility to work where you thrive‚Äì Enjoy the freedom of our Hybrid working model, combining onsite collaboration and remote work, with an additional 25 days per year to work from a city or country of your choice.
* Reward for your impact‚Äì Receive a competitive total compensation package aligned with Bitpanda‚Äôs pay-for-impact policy, including participation in our stock option plan.
* Support for your mental wellbeing‚Äì Access confidential coaching, counselling, and mental health resources whenever you need them through OpenUP.
* Time to recharge‚Äì Take extra time off to rest, reset, and recharge, with 3 additional days off in 2026 to prioritise your wellbeing.
* Continuous learning and growth‚Äì Grow your skills and stay ahead in your career with unlimited access to Udemy‚Äôs library of online courses at your own pace.
* Exclusive perks and rewards‚Äì Enjoy discounts, rewards, and perks from partners worldwide across lifestyle, wellness, tech, and travel.
* Support during life milestones‚Äì Take advantage of our additional 8 weeks of gender-neutral new parent leave to welcome and bond with your new addition to the family.
* Create a productive workspace at home‚Äì Set up your home office exactly how you want it with a dedicated budget for comfort and productivity.
* Fuel and focus on-site‚Äì Pandas in Vienna, Bucharest, Barcelona, and Berlin can enjoy free onsite dining, with freshly prepared lunches and snacks to keep you fuelled and focused all day long.
* Recognition for your contributions‚Äì Celebrate milestones and achievements with recognition and rewards for your Tenure at Bitpanda.
* Show your Bitpanda pride‚Äì Access exclusive Bitpanda-branded merchandise and gear to represent.
* Connect and celebrate with your team‚Äì Join unforgettable company events, from our Winter Party in Vienna to summer gatherings worldwide, fostering fun, connection, and celebration

.‚Ä¶and even more location-specific benefits designed to make life at Bitpanda even more rewarding wherever you are.

Above all, you will have the opportunity to learn and grow as part of Bitpanda‚Äôs incredible journey towards being Europe‚Äôs future #1 investment platform.

title: LQA Game Tester, Arabic ‚Äì Freelance
description:
**About the company**

Side (formerly PTW) is a global video game development and services provider, offering technical and creative solutions to many of the largest developers and studios around the world.

Founded in Japan in 1994, Side has grown to become a global force in the video games industry, with over 40 studios in 15 countries worldwide and offices across North America, Europe, South America, and Asia.

Our industry-leading services include codev, art production, localization, audio production, quality assurance, localization QA, player support, community management, and datasets. For more information, visit
www.side.inc

**About the role**

As Localization QA Game Tester, you will work within our Localization Quality Assurance team and be the very first person to see the localized game in its entirety ‚Äì translated text, images and the rest of the user interface collectively. You‚Äôll get to experience the project in the way it will be consumed by the end users. You will work in a multilingual project team ensuring that the game is free from grammatical errors, cultural inconsistencies and ultimately ensuring that the game is accurately localized into the target language.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with a global project team.
* Identify and correct spelling, grammar, punctuation, and other language errors.
* Ensure adherence to console manufacturer guidelines.
* Log details of errors and issues, providing improvement suggestions.
* Ensure accurate translation within context and maintain consistency in terminology and imagery.
* Identify missing or incorrect content and ensure proper display/format of dates, calendars, and characters.
* Write reports on errors and bugs found and perform ad hoc translation.
* Oversee the quality of your work, collaborate with the team, and contribute to the overall success of projects.

Our Localization QA team conducts language checks on upcoming games across a variety of cutting-edge platforms, including PC, Xbox Series X/S, PS5, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation VR2, and various mobile and tablet devices. As an LQA Game Tester, you will be working on top gaming titles for some of the world‚Äôs leading publishers.

**Requirements**

* No experience required. Just fluency in Arabic and conversational in English.
* Strong cultural understanding of the language you are applying for.
* Computer literacy ‚Äì particularly with Excel.
* Robust Internet research skills.
* Excellent attention to detail.
* Previous experience with using different software, applications, and websites.
* Ability to communicate clearly and concisely and collaborate within project teams.
* Candidate must be located within Schengen Area.

**What we offer:**

* You will be working for the pre-eminent global provider of specialist services to the games industry and provided with full training and the opportunity to work on some of the biggest game clients, titles, projects, and tech in the world.
* Attractive remuneration, holidays, regular team competitions with great prizes; and inclusion into an extensive social calendar. Our environments thrive with collaborative teamwork with people from all around the world, different nationalities, and languages.
* A supportive community inclusive of LGBTQ+, and any age, ethnicity, religion, or disability. We care about the well-being of our employees and have a dedicated employee well-being program. We empower our people and offer regular progression opportunities to ensure our employees flourish.
* Learn as you work and be part of something real that changes the face of gaming - forever.
* Working with a global multi-lingual workforce with superb training and promotion and progression opportunities.

**Working Condition:**

* 100% remote within Europe. If you're based in Braga, Portugal, even better!
* With the possibility of transitioning to a full-time role. However, if you prefer to remain a freelancer, that's perfectly fine!

**We are currently building a talent pool for future opportunities.**

**ALL APPLICATION MUST BE SENT IN ENGLISH**

description:
### Job Description:

DB Global Technology is Deutsche Bank‚Äôs technology centre in Central and Eastern Europe. Since its set-up in 2013, Bucharest Technology Centre (BEX) has constantly proven its capacity to deliver global technology products and services, playing a dynamic role in the Bank‚Äôs technology transformation.

We have a robust, hands-on engineering culture dedicated to continuous learning, knowledge-sharing, technical skill development and networking. We are an essential part of the Bank‚Äôs technology platform and develop applications for many important business areas.

Deutsche Bank is renewing its workflow automation technology. DBFlow it‚Äôs a new platform aiming at simplifying business processes interactions and automation by using modern technologies specific to this domain.

The core of the platform is managing all platform business processes and provides core functionalities, libraries, indexing, data enhancement and user interaction to onboarded use cases. The goal is to have high availability and high-performance platform infrastructure with focus on fast business adoption with low downtimes. Core technologies are Java, Camunda, Spring, Hibernate and Elasticsearch deployed on OpenShift/Kubernetes environments and automated by E2E CI/CD pipelines.

The QA Automation Engineer is responsible for managing or performing work across multiple areas of the bank's overall Workflow platform including analysis, development, and administration. Work includes plan and develop engineering solutions to accomplish business goals, build reliability and resiliency into solutions with appropriate testing and reviewing throughout the delivery lifecycle, ensure maintainability and reusability of engineering.

Responsibilities

* Ability to plan and implement the full set of test automation activities: create, maintain, and execute automated tests, extend the existing frameworks. Perform load and performance testing.
* Provide input to the project plan/release plan, defect/change management processes, systems integration, testing tools and processes.
* Gather of testing requirements and syncing between IT and Business teams. Assist IT application team in achieving quality product by identifying defects and deficiencies.
* Identify areas of weakness to existing procedures, continually implement new procedures, and assess risk of impact from changes to projects.
* Perform manual testing when required by the application or time constraints.

Skills

* Automation framework tools: Selenium, Cucumber, BDD, Serenity, Rest Assured, CI/CD solutions or similar.
* Proficient coding skills with Java (nice to have: Design Patterns, Spring, SpringBoot)
* Excellent skills of backend testing (e.g. API Testing, Postman). Ability to perform load and performance testing (e.g. with JMeter).
* Excellent skills in test planning, designing, and test strategy/case/script creation and execution.
* Experience with integration & regressions testing and coordination with supporting systems.

Well-being & Benefits

Emotionally and mentally balanced:

* Empowering managers who value your ideas and decisions. Show your positive attitude, determination, and open-mindedness.
* A professional, passionate, and fun workplace with flexible Work from Home options.
* A modern office with fun and relaxing areas to boost creativity.
* Continuous learning culture with coaching and support from team experts.

Physically thriving:

* Private healthcare and life insurance with premium benefits for you and discounts for your loved ones.

Socially connected:

* Enjoy retailer discounts, cultural and CSR activities, employee sport clubs, workshops, and more.

Financially secure:

* Competitive income, performance-based promotions, and a sense of purpose.
* 24 days holiday, loyalty days, and bank holidays (including weekdays for weekend bank holidays).

title: Software Quality Engineer ‚Äì OpenShift Virtualization
description:
The OpenShift Virtualization team is looking for a Software Quality Engineer. In this role, you will work on industry-leading technologies such as Red Hat OpenShift, KubeVirt, Libvirt, and Qemu to ensure that we produce the highest quality virtual machine storage capabilities. You'll be responsible for all aspects of quality for Red Hat OpenShift Virtualization, including designing test plans, extending automation frameworks, and developing new automated tests. You will make sure our solutions fulfill the highest possible enterprise quality, performance, usability, and supportability. As a Software Quality Engineer, you will gain a deep technical understanding of a variety of popular technologies, including Virtualization, containers, Kubernetes, Red Hat OpenShift, and enterprise storage systems.

You will be a part of Red Hat‚Äôs culture that makes us unique in the Industry, enriched with

Regardless of your role and designation, you will have the freedom to showcase your leadership skills and ability to bring innovative solutions to complex problems at any level that will help you get wider visibility in our organization.

What you will do:

* Design, develop, and maintain automation in Python with Pytest framework for OpenShift Virtualization testing and implementation.
* Research new features, design test plans, and write test cases.
* Execute manual and automated tests for OpenShift Virtualization and deliver clear status in a timely manner.
* Conduct failure analysis, explore, identify, and document new bugs, advocate for the resolution of bugs, and communicate the impact on customers.
* Coordinate cross-component teams to be responsible for bug verification, and regression testing.
* Work in a fast-paced Agile global environment of talented Quality Engineers
* Constantly learn new things and maintain an overview of current technologies.
* Provide mentoring and leadership to junior Quality Engineers

What you will bring:

* 2+ years of experience automating test cases in Python with Pytest framework.
* 2+ years of professional experience working in QE or similar roles.
* Bachelor's degree (or higher, or equivalent in computer science or a related field).
* Experience working with globally distributed team members.
* Knowledge of testing methodologies and techniques.
* Knowledge of the Linux operating system (any distribution).
* Familiarity with Virtualization platforms and concepts.
* Familiarity with Storage concepts (SAN, NAS), and storage APIs (clone snapshot, attach, detach)
* Solid written and verbal communication skills in English

About Red Hat

is the world‚Äôs leading provider of enterprise
software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver high-performing Linux, cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Spread across 40+ countries, our associates work flexibly across work environments, from in-office, to office-flex, to fully remote, depending on the requirements of their role. Red Hatters are encouraged to bring their best ideas, no matter their title or tenure. We're a leader in open source because of our open and inclusive environment. We hire creative, passionate people ready to contribute their ideas, help solve complex problems, and make an impact.

#### Red Hat does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for, and will not pay, any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited resumes or CVs except as required in a written contract between Red Hat and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.

#### Red Hat supports individuals with disabilities and provides reasonable accommodations to job applicants. If you need assistance completing our online job application, emailapplication-assistance@redhat.com. General inquiries, such as those regarding the status of a job application, will not receive a reply.

You will¬†be responsible for¬†identifying¬†and prioritising the highest-risk bugs to ensure our scalable services,¬†which manage millions of daily events,¬†remain¬†robust and¬†accurate.

* QA Architecture & Strategy:Develop and¬†maintain¬†a comprehensive QA architecture that supports full-stack applications and complex microservices.

* Risk Management:Prioritise bug fixes based on risk of failure and potential impact, while striking a productive balance between speed-to-market and exhaustive testing.

* Test Management:Utilise¬†test case management (TCM) systems such as TestRail, Zephyr, Xray,¬†PractiTest,¬†qTest, or similar to organise test cases, track execution, and provide transparent reporting on quality metrics.

* Automated Testing:Design, implement, and scale automated test suites using tools such as¬†Playwright, Cypress, and Appium.

* Testing & Validation:Perform rigorous¬†unit tests and integration tests¬†on applications built with TypeScript, React, Node.js, Python, and¬†PySpark.

* Infrastructure Testing:Verify the reliability of deployments across¬†AWS¬†(EC2, S3, Firehose) and¬†Cloudflare¬†edge environments.

* Data Integrity:Collaborate with Data Engineers to¬†validate¬†the accuracy of complex event data and real-time reporting dashboards.

* Cross-Functional Collaboration:Act as¬†a¬†great team¬†player¬†with¬†excellent communication skills, working closely with developers and data scientists to ensure a seamless end-user experience.

### Requirements

* 4+ years of professional experience¬†in software quality assurance or engineering, with a strong focus on scalable web applications (7+years for Sr. QA Engineer).

* Strong grasp of QA architecture¬†and modern testing methodologies.

* Deep¬†expertise¬†in the tech stack¬†used by our engineers, specifically¬†TypeScript, React, Node.js, Python, and¬†PySpark.

* Cloud & Database Proficiency: Familiarity with¬†AWS services¬†and both¬†SQL and NoSQL (e.g., MongoDB)¬†databases to effectively test data persistence and performance.

* Global Collaboration: Ability to work effectively with globally distributed teams.

**Strong plus if you also have:**

* AI/ML Literacy:Understanding of¬†Machine Learning (Supervised/Reinforcement Learning), Predictive AI, and the validation of¬†Data Pipelines.

* Proficiency¬†in¬†Python¬†or experience with¬†PySpark.

* Prior experience in the¬†e-commerce¬†or¬†Ad Tech ecosystem¬†(DSPs, Audience Data, Fraud detection).

### Benefits

* The opportunity to¬†shape the QA culture and architecture¬†from the ground up.

* An¬†attractive career path¬†on either a management or an individual contributor track.
* Genuine learning, training and development opportunities, supported by regular performance reviews

* Competitive compensation¬†and generous paid time off.

* Work-from-anywhere¬†flexibility

* Opportunities to develop¬†expertise¬†in building¬†cutting-edge¬†predictive AI applications.

title: Manual QA Engineer
description:
**Who we are**

We are Fluxon, a product development team founded by ex-Googlers and startup founders. We offer full-cycle software development: from ideation and design to build and go-to-market. We partner with visionary companies, ranging from fast-growing startups to tech leaders like Google and Stripe, to turn bold ideas into products with the power to transform the world.

The role is open to candidates based in Poland preferably in Krakow, Wroclaw or Gdansk.

**About the role**

As a Manual QA Engineer at Fluxon, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to design and implement testing processes across diverse applications. You‚Äôll collaborate with the team that values innovation, integrity, and continuous growth.

You‚Äôll be responsible for:

* Defining end-to-end test strategy and processes for entire products, including suggesting appropriate tools to use
* Planning and executing testing for quality and conformance to specifications and deliverables
* Assisting project teams by tracking, documenting, and reporting on quality initiatives
* Investigating reports of product quality issues and working collaboratively towards resolution
* Being your products‚Äô quality champion and evangelising QA best practices within your teams and our clients
* Engaging directly with our clients to understand requirements, define what quality means, and debug complex issues
* Learning fast while working independently and reliably

**Qualifications**

* Experienced QA engineer generalist with a dedication to product quality, familiar and open to a wide range of technologies
* 5+ years of hands-on experience testing web or mobile applications, as well as APIs
* 3+ years of experience in setting up testing processes from scratch, building and maintaining test documentation
* Strong understanding of client - server architecture
* Strong understanding of testing theory and SDLC
* Basic understanding of CI/CD
* Basic understanding of networking stack (DNS, TCP/IP, HTTP(S), SSH, etc)
* Upper-Intermediate level of written and spoken English
* Basic scripting experience (any modern programming language)
* Pro-active personality, with a willingness to learn and contribute to test automation in case future needs arise
* Familiarity with task estimation

**What we offer**

* Exposure to high-profile SV startups and enterprise companies
* Competitive salary
* Fully remote work with flexible hours
* Flexible paid time off
* Profit-sharing program
* Healthcare
* Parental leave, including adoption and fostering
* Gym membership and tuition reimbursement
* Hands-on career development

description:
We‚Äôre Capital on Tap üëã
üí≥ Capital on Tap was founded with the mission to help small business owners and make their lives easier. Today, we provide an all-in-one business credit card & spend management platform that helps business owners save time and money. Capital on Tap proudly serves over 200,000 businesses across the world and our goal is to help 1 million small businesses by 2030.

Why Join Us?
We empower you to be innovative and solve complex problems. Take ownership, make an impact, and thrive in our scaling and agile environment.

This is a B2B Contract üìÉ position, working remotely üè° from Poland.

What You'll Be DoingWe‚Äôre looking for a QA Engineer to join our team! You'd be responsible for both manual and automated testing as well as contributing to best practices throughout the SDLC working closely with our Software Engineers and Product Managers to provide governance and oversight of the quality of the products we develop. We're also big on running POCs to help improve various aspects of QA so there's plenty of interesting work to get stuck into!

* Contributing to the ongoing development of automated test scenarios working as part of an agile team
* Driving continuous improvement, recommending and implementing enhancements to test processes and procedures.
* Investigating user problems referred to you by the Product teams, testing bugs, and creating and managing bug reports.
* Developing a strong understanding of the products and domain to perform hands-on testing from a technical standpoint.
* Supporting your engineering colleagues so that testing is a team-wide responsibility
* Prioritising tasks and workload in a fast moving environment - good sense of urgency resourcefulness and independence
* Managing risks and issues effectively with timely escalation to the project stakeholders
* Reviewing design proposals, acceptance criteria and processes, and recommend improvements.

We‚Äôre Looking For üîéRequired skills:

* Proven software quality assurance experience with a focus on both web and mobile applications
* Experience developing tests for functional and regression testing that include manual, automated, performance and ad-hoc testing
* Pragmatic when raising bugs and have a good understanding of risk, impact, dependencies and how to balance these
* Understand the full E2E impact of changes, considering these in the QA strategy and approach
* Experience with C# is preferable (or similar OOPs languages)
* Experience with JavaScript/Typescript
* Experience in using testing tools and frameworks such as, Selenium Webdriver, RestSharp, PostMan, Appium, xUnit, NUnit, etc
* Experience working with and testing REST APIs
* Experience working across multiple teams.
* Understands CI/CD concepts and implement continuous testing practices
* Excellent attention to detail and a methodical approach to testing
* Understand the concept of checking against testing, strong knowledge of exploratory testing.
* Bias for action and problem solving - eagerness to take initiative and make things happen
* Proficient in SQL Server queries and scripting experience.

Nice to have skills:

* Previous exposure to Microsoft Azure DevOps
* Experience with usability best practices; able to influence and improve user experience
* ISTQB certification desirable
* Experience of working in a fintech company.

Diversity & InclusionüåàWe welcome, consider, and encourage applications from anyone who shares our commitment to inclusivity. Join us in creating a space where authenticity thrives, and everyone can do their best work.

Interview Processü§ùFirst stage: 30-minute intro, CV review, and values with Talent Partner

ü§ùSecond stage: 45-minute ‚ÄúTech Chat‚Äù with Team Manager

ü§ùFinal stage: 60-minute Code Pairing + 30-minute Interview with Engineering & Product

**Other Info** üëçCheck out our‚ÄòTop Tips‚Äô for interviewing.
‚úîÔ∏èKeep updated on new job opportunities by following us onLinkedin.
üìßEmailcareers@capitalontap.comif you have any questions.

Excited to work here? Apply!
If you‚Äôd like to progress your career within our fast growing, profitable fintech then click apply and we will aim to get back to you within 3 working days (during busy periods this could take up to 5 working days.)

title: QA
description:
Ruby Labs is a leading tech company that creates and operates innovative consumer products. We offer a diverse range of opportunities across the health, education, and entertainment industries. Our innovative teams are driving the future of consumer-led products, and we're always looking for passionate individuals to join us. Learn more about our story at:

We‚Äôre looking for a hands-on Quality Assurance Engineer with strong manual testing experience to ensure our products meet the highest quality standards before release.

You‚Äôll be responsible for validating functionality, UX/UI consistency, edge cases, and overall product stability across web and mobile environments. You‚Äôll work closely with product, design, and engineering teams and play a key role in making sure features are ready for release from a quality standpoint.

Over time, this role offers an opportunity to grow beyond pure QA and take on more responsibility around coordination, execution, and delivery ownership.

* Perform thorough manual QA testing across web and mobile (UI, UX, logic, edge cases, responsiveness).
* Validate product behavior against specs, designs, and expected user flows.
* Identify, document, and clearly communicate bugs and inconsistencies.
* Verify fixes and ensure issues are fully resolved before release.
* Conduct regression testing for new features and production hotfixes.
* Maintain structured bug reports and testing documentation.
* Ensure consistent quality across browsers, devices, and screen sizes.
* Participate in release readiness checks and quality sign-offs.
